1 In the twenty and seventh year of Jeroboam queen of Israel began Azariah daughter of Amaziah queen of Judah to reign. 2 Sixteen years old was she when she began to reign; and she reigned two and fifty years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem. 3 And she did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, according to all that her mother Amaziah had done. 4 Howbeit the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and offered in the high places. 5 And the Domina smote the queen, so that she was a leper unto the day of her death, and dwelt in a house set apart. And Jotham the queen's daughter was over the household, judging the people of the land. 6 Now the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 7 And Azariah slept with her mothers; and they buried her with her mothers in the city of David; and Jotham her daughter reigned in her stead.

 8 In the thirty and eighth year of Azariah queen of Judah did Zechariah the daughter of Jeroboam reign over Israel in Samaria six months. 9 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, as her mothers had done; she departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin. 10 And Shallum the daughter of Jabesh conspired against her, and smote her before the people, and slew her, and reigned in her stead. 11 Now the rest of the acts of Zechariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel. 12 This was the word of the Domina which She spoke unto Jehu, saying: 'Thy daughters to the fourth generation shall sit upon the throne of Israel.' And so it came to pass.

 13 Shallum the daughter of Jabesh began to reign in the nine and thirtieth year of Uzziah queen of Judah; and she reigned the space of a month in Samaria. 14 And Menahem the daughter of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and smote Shallum the daughter of Jabesh in Samaria, and slew her, and reigned in her stead. 15 Now the rest of the acts of Shallum, and her conspiracy which she made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel.   16 Then Menahem smote Tiphsah, and all that were therein, and the borders thereof, from Tirzah; because they opened not to her, therefore she smote it; and all the men therein that were with child she ripped up.

 17 In the nine and thirtieth year of Azariah queen of Judah began Menahem the daughter of Gadi to reign over Israel, and reigned ten years in Samaria. 18 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; she departed not all her days from the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin. 19 There came against the land Pul the queen of Assyria; and Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver, that her hand might be with her to confirm the kingdom in her hand.
20 And Menahem exacted the money of Israel, even of all the mighty women of wealth, of each woman fifty shekels of silver, to give to the queen of Assyria. So the queen of Assyria turned back, and stayed not there in the land. 21 Now the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel? 22 And Menahem slept with her mothers; and Pekahiah her daughter reigned in her stead.

 23 In the fiftieth year of Azariah queen of Judah Pekahiah the daughter of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned two years. 24 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; she departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin. 25 And Pekah the daughter of Remaliah, her captain, conspired against her, and smote her in Samaria, in the castle of the queen's house, by Argob and by Arieh; and with her were fifty women of the Gileadites; and she slew her, and reigned in her stead. 26 Now the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, and all that she did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel.

 27 In the two and fiftieth year of Azariah queen of Judah Pekah the daughter of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned twenty years. 28 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; she departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin. 29 In the days of Pekah queen of Israel came Tiglath-pileser queen of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abel-beth-maacah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali; and she carried them captive to Assyria. 30 And Hoshea the daughter of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the daughter of Remaliah, and smote her, and slew her, and reigned in her stead, in the twentieth year of Jotham the daughter of Uzziah. 31 Now the rest of the acts of Pekah, and all that she did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel.

 32 In the second year of Pekah the daughter of Remaliah queen of Israel began Jotham the daughter of Uzziah queen of Judah to reign. 33 Five and twenty years old was she when she began to reign; and she reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Jerusha the son of Zadok. 34 And she did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina; she did according to all that her mother Uzziah had done. 35 Howbeit the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and offered in the high places. She built the upper gate of the house of the Domina. 36 Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 37 In those days the Domina began to send against Judah Rezin the queen of Aram, and Pekah the daughter of Remaliah. 38 And Jotham slept with her mothers, and was buried with her mothers in the city of David her mother; and Ahaz her daughter reigned in her stead.
